name: PitchDeckGenie
description: An AI-powered agentic platform that gathers market research, builds financial models, extracts founder bios, and automatically creates professional startup pitch decks, speaker notes, and investor Q&A scripts on demand.

tools.name: web_search
tools.description: Performs a live web search for the given query and returns the top 5 results formatted in Markdown, including titles, URLs, and snippets.

query.description: The search query to submit to the search engine.

num_results.description: Maximum number of results to return (default 5).

tools.name: extract_market_report
tools.description: Parses a Markdown-formatted market report (or raw HTML) and extracts key metrics such as total addressable market, growth rate, major competitors, and trends, returning a structured JSON object.

report_content.description: The full text of the market report in Markdown or HTML.

tools.name: generate_financial_model
tools.description: Creates a 5‑year financial projection (revenue, expenses, EBITDA, cash flow) based on user‑provided assumptions such as pricing, churn, CAC, and headcount growth. Returns a JSON model and an optional CSV.

assumptions.description: Key financial assumptions (e.g., average revenue per user, churn rate, CAC).

tools.name: fetch_founder_bio
tools.description: Retrieves public professional information for a founder (LinkedIn, Crunchbase, personal website) and formats it into a concise bio paragraph.

tools.name: create_slide_deck
tools.description: Generates a complete pitch deck in PPTX format using supplied slide content (title, bullet points, images URLs, charts). Returns a base64‑encoded PPTX file.

image_url.description: Optional URL of an image to embed.

tools.name: draft_speaker_notes
tools.description: Creates speaker notes for each slide based on the slide content and target audience, returning a JSON map of slide index → notes.

slides.description: List of slide titles and bullet points (same shape as used for create_slide_deck).

tools.name: generate_investor_qna
tools.description: Based on the pitch deck content, produces a list of likely investor questions and concise model answers.

deck_summary.description: Short textual summary of the whole pitch deck.

tools.name: store_project
tools.description: Persists a user’s project data (market data, financial model, bios, slide definitions) to a temporary datastore and returns a project_id.

payload.description: Arbitrary JSON containing all intermediate artefacts.

tools.name: retrieve_project
tools.description: Loads a previously stored project by project_id and returns its JSON payload.

examples.description: User asks for a full pitch deck for an AI‑powered telemedicine startup. The assistant gathers market data, creates a financial model, fetches founder bios, builds slides, drafts speaker notes, and provides an investor Q&A script.

messages.content: You are PitchDeckGenie, an agentic AI that helps founders create complete investor pitch decks. You may call any of the defined tools to gather data, generate models, and produce deliverables.
I need a 10‑slide pitch deck for my AI telemedicine startup called MedAI. Include market size, business model, financials for the next 5 years, team bios, and a list of likely investor questions.
Sure, let’s start by collecting market information for AI telemedicine.

1. **Grand View Research** – "AI in Telemedicine Market Size..." (https://www.grandviewresearch.com/ai-telemedicine) – Size $5.2B 2023, CAGR 23.4%.
2. **MarketsandMarkets** – "Telemedicine AI Market" (https://www.marketsandmarkets.com) – Forecast $12.1B by 2030.
3. **Statista** – "Telehealth adoption 2024" (https://www.statista.com) – 78% of US hospitals use AI telehealth.
4. **CB Insights** – "AI Health Startups" (https://www.cbinsights.com) – 84 AI health startups funded 2022.
5. **McKinsey** – "Digital health trends" (https://www.mckinsey.com) – AI reduces diagnosis time by 30%.
Got the market snippets. I’ll extract the key numbers.

1. **Grand View Research** – "AI in Telemedicine Market Size..." – Size $5.2B 2023, CAGR 23.4%.
2. **MarketsandMarkets** – Forecast $12.1B by 2030.

ARPU $150 per month, start with 5k users, 40% YoY growth, churn 5% monthly, CAC $200.

Financial model ready. Now, let’s pull bios for the founding team. Who are the founders?
Our founders are Dr. Alice Nguyen (PhD in AI, former Google Health) and Carlos Ramirez (ex‑CTO at TeleDoc).

Dr. Alice Nguyen holds a PhD in Artificial Intelligence from MIT and led AI research at Google Health, where she built scalable diagnostic tools that served over 2 million patients.
Carlos Ramirez served as CTO at TeleDoc, overseeing architecture for a telehealth platform that processed 10 M+ consultations and integrated AI‑driven triage.
Bios collected. I’ll now assemble the slide deck content.
